gettingAround.name: Chao Phraya Boat
gettingAround.note: Scenic river transport to Old Town

safetyHealth.generalSafety: Generally safe; keep an eye on belongings in tourist zones.
safetyHealth.healthTips: Drink bottled water. Street food is popular; choose busy stalls. Consider travel insurance.

visaEntry.visaOnArrivalNote: Many nationalities receive 30–60 days visa‑free/VOA; confirm for your passport.
visaEntry.passportValidityNote: At least 6 months validity recommended from entry date.

languageComm.englishProficiencyNote: Moderate in tourist areas; translation apps help elsewhere.

internet.simNote: Tourist SIMs at airport & 7‑Eleven (AIS, TrueMove, dtac).
internet.wifiNote: Hotels, cafés, and malls commonly offer free Wi‑Fi.

currencyMoney.paymentMethodsNote: Cash common; cards in malls/hotels; ATMs widely available (fee may apply).

gettingAround.name: Metro, Tram & Marmaray
gettingAround.note: Cover most areas with transfers via Istanbulkart

gettingAround.name: Ferries
gettingAround.note: Scenic Bosphorus crossings between Europe & Asia

gettingAround.name: Taxi / BiTaksi
gettingAround.note: Use apps or insist on the meter

safetyHealth.generalSafety: Busy and generally safe; beware pickpockets in crowded areas.
safetyHealth.healthTips: Tap water may taste chlorinated; many prefer bottled. Pharmacies are common.
commonScams: Street bar scams in nightlife zones

visaEntry.visaOnArrivalNote: Many nationalities are visa‑free or e‑Visa eligible; check official site.

languageComm.englishProficiencyNote: Tourist areas moderate; basic Turkish helps.

internet.simNote: Turkcell, Vodafone, Türk Telekom shops widely available.

currencyMoney.paymentMethodsNote: Cards widely accepted; carry some cash for small vendors.

gettingAround.name: Tube & Rail
gettingAround.note: Fast across zones; contactless/Oyster works everywhere

gettingAround.name: Ride‑hailing & Black Cabs
gettingAround.note: Ubiquitous; Black Cabs can use bus lanes

safetyHealth.generalSafety: Well‑policed; watch for pickpockets in crowds.
safetyHealth.healthTips: Tap water is potable. NHS 111 for non‑emergency advice.

visaEntry.visaOnArrivalNote: Check visitor visa rules based on nationality.

internet.simNote: EE, O2, Vodafone, Three shops citywide.

safetyHealth.generalSafety: Very safe; crowded at peak hours.

visaEntry.visaOnArrivalNote: Many passport holders enjoy visa‑free stays.

safetyHealth.generalSafety: Very secure; extreme crowd density during pilgrimage—follow officials’ guidance.
safetyHealth.healthTips: Hydrate and plan around heat; medical facilities available.

visaEntry.visaOnArrivalNote: Specific Hajj/Umrah visa rules; check official portals.

languageComm.englishProficiencyNote: Basic in service sectors; Arabic predominates.

internet.simNote: STC, Mobily, Zain stores at airports/malls.

gettingAround.name: Taxis / Rides
gettingAround.note: Use meter; confirm fare for out‑of‑city trips

safetyHealth.generalSafety: Very safe; strict local laws—be respectful.

visaEntry.visaOnArrivalNote: Many passports receive visa‑free/VOA; verify beforehand.
Many nationalities visa‑free for short stays.

internet.wifiNote: Public Wi‑Fi and hotel networks common.

safetyHealth.generalSafety: Tourist areas are busy—watch for pickpockets.
safetyHealth.healthTips: Tap water safe. Pharmacies marked by green crosses.

visaEntry.visaOnArrivalNote: Schengen rules apply for EU/EEA and third‑country nationals.

safetyHealth.generalSafety: Urban precautions apply; watch bags in crowds.
safetyHealth.healthTips: Hydrate—tropical climate; tap water is treated but many prefer bottled.

visaEntry.visaOnArrivalNote: Many nationalities visa‑free for short stays—verify rules.
